metadata.title: CVE-2021-4120 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
snapd 2.54.2 fails to perform sufficient validation of snap contentinterface and layout paths, resulting in the ability for snaps to injectarbitrary AppArmor policy rules via malformed content interface and layoutdeclarations and hence escape strict snap confinement. Fixed in snapdversions 2.54.3+18.04, 2.54.3+20.04 and 2.54.3+21.10.1

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4120` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

snap-confine - 2.54.3+18.04
snapd - 2.54.3+18.04
snapd-xdg-open - 2.54.3+18.04
ubuntu-core-launcher - 2.54.3+18.04
ubuntu-core-snapd-units - 2.54.3+18.04
ubuntu-snappy - 2.54.3+18.04
ubuntu-snappy-cli - 2.54.3+18.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: snapd package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.54.3+18.04').
